alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 6:18PM EST until December 18 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast, East Central, North Central, and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 618 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Houlton, Millinocket, Dover-Foxcroft, Howland, Patten, Danforth, Brownville Junction, Milo, East Millinocket, Medway, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Springfield, Amity, Topsfield, Haynesville and Sherman Station. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
